definitions.definition: a person holding a position of command or authority in the armed services, in the merchant marine, or on a passenger ship.
examples: official, officeholder, committee member, board member; Morepublic servant, administrator, executive, functionary, bureaucrat; derogatoryapparatchik "the officers of the society"Morepublic servant, administrator, executive, functionary, bureaucrat; apparatchik the officers of the society

police officer, policeman, policewoman, officer of the law, law-enforcement officer/agent, peace officer, patrolman, trooper; Moreinformalcop, copper, flatfoot "all the officers in this precinct carry guns"Morecop, copper, flatfoot all the officers in this precinct carry guns

definitions.definition: a holder of a public, civil, or ecclesiastical office.
a holder of a post in a society, company, or other organization, especially one who is involved at a senior level in its management.
a member of a certain grade in some honorary orders.

examples: the aristocracy continued to wield considerable political power, officering the army

definitions.definition: act as the commander of (a unit).
examples: foreign mercenaries were hired to officer new regiments
